Question
========

A multiple regression analysis is performed with three *explanatory variables*. It is collectively examined whether with the three variables the regression has a significant effect on the prediction. To that end the null hypothesis is established which states that H~0~: β~1~ = β~2~ = β~3~
= 0. The alternative hypothesis, which states the opposite of the null hypothesis, states that

Answerlist
----------

* All slopes (βs) are unequal to 0.
* At least one slope (β) is unequal to 0.
* All slopes (βs) are different.

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* All slopes (βs) are unequal to 0: Incorrect
* At least one slope (β) is unequal to 0: Correct
* All slopes (β's) are different...: Incorrect
